TextBody:
Hi Amir,

My colleagues from the dev team are currently working on an Offline Client Patch that can be installed and will contain the EPP clients with the fix. This is not ready however and as an alternative MDM tools can be used to deploy the EPP clients with the fix.

I will attach instructions for the 2 MDM's we currently have guides for the EPP client deployment.

JAMF: https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_5_JAMF_Deployment_User_Manual_EN.pdf 
Intune: https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/pdf/manual/Endpoint_Protector_5_Intune_Deployment_Guide_EN.pdf

Change IP script for JAMF deployment: https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_files/epp_change_ip_epp_run.zip

EPP clients containing the fix:
macOS: https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/EppClientVulnerability/EPPMac3.0.2.2005.Notarized.tar
Windows: https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/EppClientVulnerability/EPPClient_v6.2.2.2005.zip

Please let me know if there is any other information that I can provide.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com
ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0CXBkC:ref

TextBody:
Hi Amir,

Unfortunately we do not have instructions for Kandji, but I think it is similar to JAMF for which we have instructions.

The installer file(based on the OS) should be replaced in the MDM. I will link them below:
macOS: https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/EppClientVulnerability/EPPMac3.0.2.2005.Notarized.tar
Windows: https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/EppClientVulnerability/EPPClient_v6.2.2.2005.zip

If you would like we can schedule a quick call for tomorrow to further discuss this.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000CXBkC:ref

Hi There, 

This morning I received an email with the subject "Important Update to Security Advisory – ADV-2024-002 – Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities in CoSoSys Endpoint Protector and CoSoSys Unify" While there is a new live update for the host, I am not certain if there is a new update for the endpoints that I need to push other than the one above. 

Can you please let me know if my org is safe with the endpoint hotfixes you provided above?
Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #413652 - (CVE-2024-36072)

TextBody:
Hi Amir,

We have received an update from our colleagues regarding the new Hotfix. It should now be available.

Please let me know if you have availability today or Monday for a quick remote session so we can apply the hotfix together.

Regarding the EPP clients, from what was investigated so far the issue was with the initial EPP server side hotfix, which was resolved by applying the new Hotfix 1.1. The clients provided last week for the initial hotfix should be working correctly as the issue did not affect them.

Download links for the clients with the hotfix:
macOS: https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/EppClientVulnerability/EPPMac3.0.2.2005.Notarized.tar
Windows: https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/EppClientVulnerability/EPPClient_v6.2.2.2005.zip

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com
